title: How to write my thesis ahead and not do it few weeks before the deadline - Quora

response.answer_text: No one can write a good thesis in a few weeks. The fastest I have seen was a month. But that person wrote a thesis that got rejected at the defense. The board gave her another month to write a whole new thesis. And she did. The second one was written from scratch. BUT she already knew the literature (because she had written a literature review before). To really start from scratch is pretty impossible. I guess it depends on what level of thesis and in what subject. But I stand by my point because most of the time, it will be true. My advice: Organize organize organize. Acknowledge that it will take around a year and start working accordingly.

Arrange your sources of information just now - it will help you later. Make a plan. Don’t force yourself to do everything at the time - step by step. With plan and literature you at least will have an idea about how to arrange your thesis. Personally I did like this and it helped, but next time I forgot to follow these step and I ordered a thesis from http://writemypaper.today/research-paper-writing.php . It’s cool when no need to worry about deadlines and you have a great written paper. If you need it as well - try. And good luck with deadlines.

start chunking You must have some idea what your thesis will cover, so you can start your basic research and compilation now: Comprehensive or exhaustive bibliography chapter headings based on what you know, what you think you know, and what you know you don’t know but plan to learn fill it in over time and continue to flesh out your argument as you go through your coursework and get more beta on you subject matter
